Let t be the number of test tubes, b be the number of beakers, and p be the number of Petri dishes. We know that t + b + p = 29, t = p - 2, and b = 7.
Substituting the first equation into the second equation, we get p - 2 + b + p = 29
Substituting the third equation into the resulting equation, we get p - 2 + 7 + p = 29
Combining like terms, we get 2p - 2 = 29
Adding 2 to both sides, we get 2p = 31
Dividing both sides by 2, we get p = 31 / 2 = <<31/2=15.5>>15.5
Substituting this value back into t = p - 2, we get t = 15.5 - 2 = <<15.5-2=13.5>>13.5
Substituting this value back into t + b + p = 29, we get 13.5 + b + 15.5 = 29
Subtracting 29 from both sides, we get b = 29 - 13.5 - 15.5 = 0
Since b = 7, we know that Igor lost 7 - 0 = <<7-0=7>>7 beakers.
